<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Senior Secured Credit Facilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On November&#160;10, 2016, the Company entered into the Amended and Restated Agreement (the &#8220;Amended and Restated Agreement&#8221;) by and among the Company, the guarantors party thereto, the lenders party thereto (the &#8220;Lenders&#8221;) and Deutsche Bank AG New York Branch, as administrative agent and collateral agent (respectively, the &#8220;Administrative Agent&#8221; and the &#8220;Collateral Agent&#8221;), to the Credit Agreement, by and among the Company, the lenders party thereto, the Administrative Agent and the Collateral Agent, dated as of October&#160;9, 2012 (as amended, supplemented or modified from time to time prior to the date hereof, the &#8220; Existing Credit Agreement&#8221; and as amended and restated in accordance with the Amendment and Restatement Agreement, the &#8220;Amended and Restated Credit Agreement&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Amended and Restated Credit Agreement includes a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;billion Term Loan B facility maturing 2023, and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;million Revolving Credit Facility maturing 2021 (together "Senior Secured Credit Facilities"). The Revolving Credit Facility allows for up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of letters of credit outstanding. The proceeds were used to repay borrowings under the Existing Credit Agreement and to call a portion of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes due 2020. All outstanding borrowings under the Existing Credit Agreement were either repaid in full or converted to the new Senior Secured Credit Facility. At the Company&#8217;s option, borrowings under the Amended and Restated Credit Agreement will bear interest at an alternate base rate or adjusted LIBOR rate in each case plus an applicable margin. The alternate base rate is defined as the greater of the prime rate, the federal funds rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50 basis points
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or the adjusted LIBOR rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100 basis points
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The LIBOR base rate is subject to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;floor.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	77
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Advanced Disposal Services, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.609375%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(In millions, unless otherwise indicated)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In the case of the Term Loan B, the applicable margin is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for ABR Loans and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for Eurodollar Loans. In the case of the Revolving Credit Facility, the applicable margin is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for ABR Loans and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for Eurodollar Loans if the Company's total net leverage ratio is greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.00:1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. If the Company's total net leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.00:1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the applicable margin on the Revolving Credit Facility is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for ABR Loans and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum for Eurodollar Loans.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Obligations under the Amended and Restated Credit Agreement are guaranteed by the Company&#8217;s existing and future domestic restricted subsidiaries (subject to certain exceptions) and are secured by a first-priority security interest in substantially all the personal property assets, and certain real property assets, of the Company and the guarantors, including all or a portion of the equity interests of certain of the Company&#8217;s domestic subsidiaries (in each cases, subject to certain limited exceptions).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Borrowings under the Amended and Restated Credit Agreement may be prepaid at any time without premium. The Amended and Restated Credit Agreement contains usual and customary representations and warranties, and usual and customary affirmative and negative covenants, including limitations on liens, additional indebtedness, investments, restricted payments, asset sales, mergers, affiliate transactions and other customary limitations, as well as a total net leverage ratio financial covenant (for the benefit of lenders under the revolving credit facility only). The Amended and Restated Credit Agreements also contains usual and customary events of default, including non-payment of principal, interest, fees and other amounts, material breach of a representation or warranty, nonperformance of covenants and obligations, default on other material debt, bankruptcy or insolvency, material judgments, incurrence of certain material ERISA liabilities, impairment of loan documentation or security and change of control. Compliance with these covenants is a condition to any incremental borrowings under our Senior Secured Credit Facilities and failure to meet these covenants would enable the lenders to require repayment of any outstanding loans (which would adversely affect our liquidity).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Term Loan B has payments due quarterly of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.75
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with mandatory prepayments due to the extent net cash proceeds from the sale of assets exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in any fiscal year and are not reinvested in the business within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	365 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from the date of sale, upon notification of the Company&#8217;s intent to take such action or in accordance with excess cash flow, as defined. Further prepayments are due when there is excess cash flow, as defined.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Borrowings under the Company's Senior Secured Credit Facilities can be used for working capital, capital expenditures, acquisitions and other general corporate purposes. As of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$32.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in borrowings outstanding under our Revolving Credit Facility. As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company had an aggregate of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$42.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	45.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of letters of credit outstanding under our Senior Secured Credit Facilities. As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company had remaining capacity under its Revolving Credit Facility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$257.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$222.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. As of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company was in compliance with the covenants under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities. The Company's ability to maintain compliance with itsd covenants will be highly dependent on results of operations and, to the extent necessary, its ability to implement remedial measures such as reductions in operating costs. The Revolving Credit Facility has an annual commitment fee equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum&#160;if the total net leverage ratio is greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.00:1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or&#160;if otherwise,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.375%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum. The amount of fees for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were not significant. The Company is subject to a maximum total net leverage ratio of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.75:1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5.625% Senior Notes due 2024
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:32PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On November&#160;10, 2016, the Company closed a 144A offering (the &#8220;Notes Offering&#8221;) exempt from registration under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;), of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$425.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;aggregate principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.625%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;senior notes due 2024 (the &#8220;Notes&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company issued the Notes under an indenture dated November&#160;10, 2016 (the &#8220;Indenture&#8221;) among the Company, the guarantors party thereto, and Wells Fargo Bank, National Association, as trustee (the &#8220;Trustee&#8221;). The Notes will bear interest at the rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.625%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per year. Interest on the Notes is payable on May&#160;15 and November 15 of each year, beginning on May&#160;15, 2017. The Notes will mature on November&#160;15, 2024. Before November&#160;15, 2019, the Company may redeem the Notes, in whole or in part, at a redemption price equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of their principal amount plus a make-whole premium and accrued and unpaid interest to the date of redemption. At any time on or after November&#160;15, 2019, the Company may redeem the Notes, in whole or in part, at the applicable redemption prices set forth in the Indenture, plus accrued interest. In addition, before
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	78
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Indenture contains covenants that, among other things, restrict the ability of the Company and its restricted subsidiaries to incur additional debt or issue certain preferred stock; pay dividends (subject to certain exceptions) or make certain redemptions, repurchases or distributions or make certain other restricted payments or investments; create liens; enter into transactions with affiliates; merge, consolidate or sell, transfer or otherwise dispose of all or substantially all of the Company&#8217;s assets; transfer and sell assets; and create restrictions on dividends or other payments by the Company&#8217;s restricted subsidiaries. Certain covenants will cease to apply to the Notes for so long as the Notes have investment grade ratings. The Notes will be unconditionally guaranteed, jointly and severally, on a senior unsecured basis by all of the Company&#8217;s current and future U.S. subsidiaries that guarantee the Amended and Restated Credit Agreement. As of December&#160;31, 2016, the Company was in compliance with the covenants under the Indenture.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	8.25% Senior Notes due 2020
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On October&#160;9, 2012, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$550.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;aggregate principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes, which were scheduled to mature in October 2020. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes were redeemed and repaid in full during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016 with funds obtained from the new Term Loan B and the issuance of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.625%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Original Issue Discount and Debt Issuance Costs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October of fiscal 2016, The Company prepaid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$326.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of its Existing Term Loan B with its initial public offering proceeds and recorded a loss on extinguishment of debt of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for unamortized original issue discount and debt issuance costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	When the Company refinanced its Term Loan B facility in November 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	95%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was accounted for as a modification and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was accounted for as an extinguishment based on an analysis of the participation of each lender in the syndicate before and after the refinancing. As a result of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;that was accounted for as an extinguishment,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the unamortized original issue discount and deferred debt issuance costs were recorded as a loss on extinguishment of debt. In relation to the modification, the Company incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of third party fees which were recorded as a loss on modification of debt. The Company incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of third party fees related to new lenders in the syndicate which were recorded as a reduction to the carrying value of debt and will be amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method. Additionally, the Company recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of original issue discount as a reduction to the carrying value of debt and it will be amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	When the Company amended its Revolver in November 2016, the Company incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in third party financing fees which were recorded as an other long term asset and will be amortized to interest expense on a straight line basis over the term of the Revolver.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	When the Company redeemed its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$550.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016, the Company paid a call premium of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Company recorded the call premium as a loss on extinguishment of debt during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016. Additionally, the Company recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of loss on extinguishment of debt related to unamortized original issue discount and deferred debt issuance costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November of fiscal 2016 when the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$425.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.625%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes due 2024, the Company incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in debt issuance costs which were recorded as a reduction to the carrying value of debt and will be amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	79
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Fair Value of Debt
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The fair value of the Company&#8217;s debt is estimated using discounted cash flow analyses, based on rates the Company would currently pay for similar types of instruments except for variable rate debt for which cost approximates fair value due to the short-term nature of the interest rate (Level 2 inputs). Although the Company has determined the estimated fair value amounts using available market information and commonly accepted valuation methodologies, considerable judgment is required in interpreting the information and in developing the estimated fair values. Therefore, these estimates are not necessarily indicative of the amounts that the Company, or holders of the instruments, could realize in a current market exchange. The fair value estimates are based on information available as of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The estimated fair value of our debt is as follows at December&#160;31:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Unconditional Purchase Commitments
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has unconditional purchase commitments not recorded on the balance sheet which consist of disposal related agreements that include fixed or minimum royalty payments, disposal related host agreements, capital expenditure commitments and payments for premiums on interest rate caps. The Company has unconditional purchase commitments recorded on the balance sheet which consist of waste relocation obligations. The amounts purchased under these commitments during fiscal 2016, 2015 and 2014 were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$20.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$13.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The following table summarizes our unconditional purchase commitments as of December 31, 2016:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The total rental expense for all operating leases for the years ended December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Direct rental expense, consisting of rental expense at operating locations, is included in operating expenses, and rental expense for corporate offices is included in selling, general and administrative expenses in the consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	14.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Stockholders' Equity and Stock Options
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(Share and per share amounts not in millions)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Initial Public Offering (IPO)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company closed its IPO on October 12, 2016 in which it sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19,250,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock to new shareholders at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share and received net proceeds of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$324.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;after underwriting fees, commissions and expenses. The underwriters exercised their option to purchase an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2,887,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares from the Company, at the initial public offering price, less the underwriting discounts and commissions. The Company received proceeds from the underwriters option of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$49.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The proceeds from the IPO were used to repay the Term Loan B facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Split
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the IPO, the Company effected a stock split and recapitalization and issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	64,493,536
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock directly to existing shareholders. All share and per share amounts in these financial statements and related notes have been retrospectively adjusted to give effect to the stock split.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2012 Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October 2012, the former Parent&#8217;s Board of Directors adopted the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220; 2012 Plan&#8221;) under which an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	7,154,711
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the former Parent&#8217;s common stock was reserved for issuance. The 2012 Plan provided for employees of the Company to participate in the plan and provided that the options or stock purchase rights have a term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ten years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and vest equally over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	four years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the options being vested at the date of grant for all options except the Strategic grants which vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;after
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. All options of the Strategic Plan issued prior to 2010 vested upon a change of control. All other options vest in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;tranches from the date of issuance upon a change of control.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal 2016, the Board of Directors of the Parent amended the 2012 Plan to allow for the grant of performance shares, restricted shares, restricted share units, and other equity awards in addition to stock options and stock purchase rights as originally provided for under the 2012 Plan. Upon completion of the Company's IPO during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016, no further awards will be issued under the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	80
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2016 Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company's board of directors adopted the Advanced Disposal Services, Inc. 2016 Omnibus Equity Plan (the "2016 Plan") on January 29, 2016 under which an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5,030,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock was reserved for issuance. The 2016 Plan became effective on October 4, 2016 and will terminate on the tenth anniversary of the 2016 Plan effective date, unless sooner terminated by the Company's board of directors. Awards under the 2016 Plan may consist of stock options, restricted shares, restricted share units, stock appreciation rights, performance stock, performance stock units, cash performance units and other awards. The Compensation Committee shall set the vesting criteria applicable to each award, which will determine the extent to which the award becomes exercisable. The terms and conditions of each award shall be set forth in an award document in a form approved by the Compensation Committee for such Award.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Option Grants

</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#BFE4FF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#BFE4FF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30.0%
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Since the Company does not have enough historical exercise data that is indicative of expected future exercise performance, it has elected to use the &#8220;simplified method&#8221; to estimate the options expected term by taking the average of each vesting-tranche and the contractual term. The Company used the average ten day historical volatility for public companies in the solid waste sector to estimate historical volatility used in the Black-Scholes model. The risk-free rate used was based on the US Treasury security rate estimated for the expected term of the option at the date of grant. No dividends are expected to be issued. The company recognizes forfeitures of stock options as they occur. The Company issues new shares when stock options are exercised.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal 2016, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	555,969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;stock option grants under the 2012 Plan for employees other than the Named Executive Officers (NEOs). Each option had an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.35
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per option on the date of grant. The options will vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on date of grant and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in four equal installments over each of the first four anniversaries of the date of the grant. The exercise price of the stock options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was equal to the estimated fair market value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date. The contractual term of the options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal 2016, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	96,922
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;NEO option grants under the 2012 Plan. Each option had an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.07
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per option on the date of grant. The options will vest in three equal installments over each of the first three anniversaries of the date of the grant. The exercise price of the stock options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was equal to the estimated fair market value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date. The contractual term of the options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the IPO, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	58,103
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;stock options under the 2016 Plan with a fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to employees other than the NEO&#8217;s, which will be expensed over the vesting period. These awards vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on the date of grant and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on each of the first four anniversaries of the date of grant. The exercise price of the stock options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was equal to the fair market value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date. The contractual term of the options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years and each option had an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.80
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per option on the date of grant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the IPO, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	659,899
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;stock options under the 2016 Plan with a fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to the NEOs of the Company which will be recognized in expense over the vesting period. These awards are scheduled to vest in full on the third anniversary of the date of grant. The exercise price of the stock options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was equal to the fair market value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date. The contractual term of the options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years and each option had an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.91
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	$3.6

	$1.0

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted Stock Grants
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30,384

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;NEO restricted stock grants under the 2012 Plan with an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. The restricted stock will vest in three equal installments over each of the first three anniversaries of the date of the grant. For fiscal 2016,
</FONT>

	none
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the NEO restricted stock was forfeited. As of December 31, 2016, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30,384
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted stock outstanding under the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the IPO,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5,556
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted stock were issued to a non-employee director with a value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. This award is scheduled to vest in full on the third anniversary of the date of grant. The restricted stock was valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was the fair value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted Stock Unit Grants
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the IPO, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	300,001
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;restricted stock units to the NEOs of the Company with a fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;which will be recognized in expense over the vesting period. These awards are scheduled to vest in full on the third anniversary of the date of grant. The restricted stock units were valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, which was the fair value of the Company&#8217;s stock on the grant date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Performance Stock Unit Grants
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal 2016, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	60,767
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;NEO performance stock units (PSUs) issued under the 2012 Plan with an estimated fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. The PSUs will vest in full on the third anniversary of the date of the grant. The PSUs shall be measured based on the budget and are weighted as follows: EBITDA:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	; Free Cash Flow:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	; and Revenue:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The measurement criteria begins with an attainment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the budget which results in vesting of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares underlying the PSUs granted and ends with an attainment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	110%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the budget which results in vesting of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	175%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares underlying the PSUs granted. Performance will be measured separately for each of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years in the performance period and the total number of PSUs earned at the conclusion of the three three year performance period will be the sum of the PSUs earned with respect to each individual year. The NEO's earned approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	81%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of their performance stock units in fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Performance Option Grants
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During fiscal 2016, the Company and its Chief Executive Officer (CEO), entered into an amendment to the CEO's employment agreement. The amendment adjusted the performance criteria applicable to performance-based stock options that the CEO was eligible to earn with respect to 2016. Previously, the only applicable criterion was EBITDA; the amendment provided that the number of performance-based stock options earned would be based on EBITDA (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) and free cash flow (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	). The
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	82
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Advanced Disposal Services, Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.609375%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(In millions, unless otherwise indicated)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:10PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	amendment also clarified that the full potential grant of performance-based stock options (covering up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	190,792
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of Parent's common stock) was still available to be earned by the CEO. The CEO earned approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	62%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of these performance options.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Compensation Expense
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Compensation expense is recognized ratably over the vesting period for those awards that vest. For fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company recognized share-based compensation expense as a component of selling, general and administrative expenses of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. As of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company estimates that a total of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of currently unrecognized compensation expense will be recognized over a weighted average period of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.74
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years for unvested awards issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="ADS201610-KDOCUMENT_HTM_S8B06B8871C1C55E897FDA3EB78E10FCC">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	15.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Insurance
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company carries insurance coverage for protection of its assets and operations from certain risks including automobile liability, general liability, real and personal property damage, workers&#8217; compensation claims, directors&#8217; and officers&#8217; liability, pollution liability, employee group health claims and other coverages that are customary in the industry. The Company&#8217;s exposure to loss for insurance claims is generally limited to the per incident deductible under the related insurance policy. As of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company&#8217;s insurance programs carried self-insurance exposures of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per incident for general liability, automobile and workers&#8217; compensation, respectively. Certain self-insurance claims reserves are recorded at present value using a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.47%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.31%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;discount rate as of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a partially self-insured employee group health insurance program that carries an aggregate stop loss amount. The amount recorded for the health insurance liability at December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for unpaid claims, including an estimate for IBNR claims, was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Liabilities are recorded gross of expected recoveries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The self-insured portion of workers&#8217; compensation liability for unpaid claims and associated expenses, including IBNR claims, is based on an actuarial valuation and internal estimates. The amount recorded for workers&#8217; compensation liability at December&#160;31, 2016 and 2015 for unpaid claims, including an estimate for IBNR claims, is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$23.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The self-insured portion of general liability and automobile liability for unpaid claims and associated expenses, including IBNR claims, is based on an actuarial valuation and internal estimates. The amount recorded for general and automobile liability at December&#160;31, 2016 and 2015 for unpaid claims, including an estimate for IBNR claims, was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Of the above amounts,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$19.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is included in accrued expenses and the remainder is included in other long-term liabilities at December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="ADS201610-KDOCUMENT_HTM_S26018CC266595FDDAC9297D72BCDED58">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	16.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has 401(k) Savings Plans (&#8220;401(k) Plan&#8221;) for the benefit of qualifying full-time employees who have more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days of service and are over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years of age. Employees make pre-tax contributions to the 401(k) Plan with a partial matching contribution made by the Company. The Company&#8217;s matching contributions to the 401(k) Plan were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Contributions by the Company are included in operating costs and expenses in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company is a participating employer in a number of trustee-managed multiemployer, defined benefit pension plans for employees who participate in collective bargaining agreements. Approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	13%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the Company&#8217;s workforce is subject to a collective bargaining agreement and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	none
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the collective bargaining agreements expire within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;year. The risks of participating in the multiemployer plans are different from single-employer plans in that (i)&#160;assets contributed to the multiemployer plan by one employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating employers; (ii)&#160;if a participating employers stops contributing to the plan, the unfunded obligations of the plan may be required to be assumed by the remaining participating employers; and (iii)&#160;if the Company chooses to stop participating in any of the multiemployer plans, it may be required to pay those plans a withdrawal amount based on the underfunded status of the plan. The total contributions made to all plans for fiscal 2016 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is related to plans that are not individually significant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	83
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(A)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The employers' contributions to the plan represent greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;of the total contributions to the plan for the most recent plan year available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:33PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(B)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	A multi-employer defined benefit pension plan that has been certified as endangered, seriously endangered, or critical may begin to levy a statutory surcharge on contribution rates. Once authorized, the surcharge is at the rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;for the first 12 months and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;for any periods thereafter. Contributing employers, however, may eliminate the surcharge by entering into a collective bargaining agreement that meets the requirements of the applicable funding improvement plan or rehabilitation plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</A>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	17.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The components of the benefit from income taxes from continuing operations are comprised of the following for the years ended December&#160;31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#BFE4FF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s deferred tax assets and liabilities from continuing operations relate to the following sources and differences between financial accounting and the tax basis of the Company&#8217;s assets and liabilities at December&#160;31:

</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(In millions, unless otherwise indicated)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective for the fourth quarter of 2016, the Company adopted Accounting Standards Update (ASU) 2016-09, Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting. This standard requires the Company to account for all of the tax effects related to share-based compensation through the statement of operations. For fiscal 2016, the adoption of this standard caused
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to be recognized as a component of the benefit from income taxes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The amounts recorded as deferred tax assets as of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;represent the amounts of tax benefits of existing deductible temporary differences or net operating and capital loss carryforwards. Realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of sufficient taxable income prior to expiration of any loss carryforwards. A valuation allowance has been recorded against deferred tax assets as of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$98.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The valuation allowance for the year ended December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$95.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Company has established valuation allowances for uncertainties in realizing the benefit of certain tax loss and credit carryforwards. While the Company expects to realize the deferred tax assets, net of the valuation allowances, changes in estimates of future taxable income or in tax laws may alter this expectation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company had available federal NOL carryforwards from continuing operations of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$476.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$417.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively. The Company&#8217;s federal net operating losses have expiration dates beginning in the year 2019 through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2033
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;if not utilized against taxable income. The capital losses of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$182.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;expire in 2017 and 2018, if not previously utilized against capital gains.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	With the completion of the IPO in the fourth quarter of 2016, the Company experienced an ownership change pursuant to Section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code ("IRC"). This limitation is not expected to have an impact on the Company's ability to fully utilize its NOLs before expiration. Additionally, the Company has grown through a series of acquisitions and mergers and has had change of control events that resulted in limitations on the utilization of NOLs pursuant to Section&#160;382 of the IRC. Approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$139.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the NOLs from continuing operations are limited under the SRLY rules of the IRC. These NOLs are only available to be utilized against taxable income of the HWStar Waste Holdings, Corp. and subsidiaries thereof, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. At this time, the Company expects to utilize these NOLs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A predecessor of the Company had a transaction on November 1, 2005 that was treated as a reorganization. The Company estimates that it is subject to an annual limitation of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on NOLs of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$29.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;originating prior to November 1, 2005.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</DIV>
